Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new spear-phishing campaign targeting U.S. energy providers via FlowCloud, a new remote access trojan (RAT) capable of providing attackers with full control over infected systems.
Target Class: D Electricity gas steam and air conditioning supply

Author: Avaddon
Description: Researchers from Appriver discover a new Avaddon Ransomware campaign targeting users worldwide.

Author: Dark Basin
Target: Environmental advocacy groups, journalists, and others
Description: A joint report by Citizen Labs and the University of Toronto reveals the details of a Dark Basin, a massive hack-for-hire operation targeting especially climate-change organizations who were campaigning against Exxon Mobil.
Target Class: U Activities of extraterritorial organizations and bodies
Tags: Dark Basin, Exxon Mobil, Citizen Lab, University of Toronto

Description: Australian beverage giant Lion is hit by a Ransomware attack.
Target Class: I Accommodation and food service activities

Description: Security researchers from RiskIQ discover a new wave of attacks relying on Magecart and malicious redirector code lurking in misconfigured S3 buckets.

Author: R3dr0x
Description: Researchers from Cyble report that a threat actor is offering in a dark web black-market documents of the Indian defence contractor Bharat Earth Movers Limited (BEML)
Tags: Cyble, R3dr0x, Bharat Earth Movers Limited, BEML

Description: Researchers from Sophos reveal that the operators behind the Kingminer botnet have recently started targeting vulnerable Microsoft SQL Servers using brute-force methods in order to mine cryptocurrency.
Tags: Sophos, Kingminer, Microsoft SQL Servers, Crypto

Description: Slovak authorities arrest four suspects as part of an investigation into a series of suspicious devices found connected to the government's official IT network.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Maze
Description: U.S. system-on-chip (SOC) maker company MaxLinear discloses that some of its computing systems were encrypted by Maze Ransomware operators. The attack was discovered on May 24.
A recent phishing email campaign discovered by Abuse.ch asks to vote anonymously about Black Lives Matter to spread the TrickBot information-stealing malware.

Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a new phishing campaign targeting business owners with Microsoft Office 365, and using bait emails designed to look like legitimate Small Business Grants Fund (SGF) relief payment messages from the UK government.
Tags: Abnormal Security, Microsoft Office 365, Small Business Grants Fund, SGF, COVID-19

Description: Researchers from Recorded Future discover a new Ransomware-as-a-service, dubbed Thanos, with high evasion capabilities.

Microsoft reveals that attackers recently hijacked powerful machine-learning clusters inside Microsoft’s Azure cloud-computing service to mine cryptocurrency at the expense of the customers who rented them.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Researchers from Google report an increase in the number of COVID-19 related scams.
Researchers from Google discover a new campaign targeting small businesses in the UK, designed to look like legitimate Small Business Grants Fund (SGF) messages.
Tags: Google, Small Business Grants Fund, SGF

Description: Researchers from Google discover a phishing campaign themed with streaming services, targeting Brazilian users.

Target: Single Individuals in Armenia, India, Brazil, Chhattisgarh, Columbia, Indonesia, India, Iran, Italy, Kyrgyzstan, Russia and Singapore.
Description: Researchers from Anomali identify 12 fake COVID-19 contact tracing apps targeting citizens in Armenia, India, Brazil, Chhattisgarh, Columbia, Indonesia, Iran, Italy, Kyrgyzstan, Russia and Singapore.
Tags: Anomali, Armenia, India, Brazil, Columbia, Indonesia, India, Iran, Italy, Kyrgyzstan, Russia and Singapore.

Description: The city of Keizer is hit with a ransomware attack, and is able to restore the data, paying the perpetrators a $48,000 ransom.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: The City of Knoxville, Tennessee, was forced to shut down its entire computer network following a ransomware attack that took place overnight and targeted the city's offices.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Security researchers at F5 Labs discover ongoing attacks using Qbot malware payloads to steal credentials from customers of dozens of US financial institutions.

TAIT Towers, one of the world's leading live event solutions providers, discloses a data breach that led to the exposure of personal and financial information stored on a server and on the email accounts of some of its employees.

Author: Gamaredon (Primitive Bear)
Description: Researchers from ESET discover new recent campaigns by Gamaredon (Primitive Bear) containing a Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) project (.OTM file) targeting Microsoft Outlook email client with malicious macro scripts.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security
Tags: ESET, Gamaredon, Primitive Bear, VBA, Microsoft Outlook

Author: China, Russia, and Turkey
Description: Twitter discloses three new state-linked operations on its platform this year. As a result of its investigation, it bans and removes 32,242 accounts operated out of China, Russia, and Turkey, pushing local political agendas and narratives, and associated with state-sponsored entities.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: A1 Telekom, the largest internet service provider in Austria, admits a malware security breach from December 2019 to May 2020.

Author: Earth Empusa, AKA POISON CARP/Evil Eye,
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the Earth Empusa threat group (aka POISON CARP/Evil Eye) is targeting the Uyghurs minority with a new Android spyware dubbed ActionSpy.
Tags: Trend Micro, Earth Empusa, POISON CARP/Evil Eye, Uyghurs, Android, ActionSpy

Description: Infinity Diagnostics Center Instagram account is compromised by an unknown hacker. After gaining access, the threat actor uploads multiple stories designed to paint the business as racist.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: eHealth Saskatchewan admits to have suffered a ransomware attack on December 20.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Sodinokibi AKA REvil
Description: Activewear reveals to have suffered a Sodinokibi ransomware attack back in May 2020.

Target: University of Missouri Health Care (MU Health Care)
Description: University of Missouri Health Care (MU Health Care) discloses a breach that occurred in September 2019, when the email accounts of some students was been accessed without authorization.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities
Tags: University of Missouri Health Care, MU Health Care

Description: A new malware called TroyStealer targets Portuguese users.
The NHS confirms that 113 internal email accounts were compromised and used to send malicious spam between May 30 and June 1 2020.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: m1x
Description: A Russian hacker named m1x breaches a Mexican government web portal (puebla.gob.mx) and three days later once the government refused to pay a ransom, publicly-releases some 14,000 Mexican taxpayer ID numbers.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Electronic Waveform Lab, Inc. reveals it suffered a ransomware attack on April 11, 2020.
Cano Health warns its patients of a phishing attack involving three employees, discovered on April 2020 and occurred on May 2018.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: A data leak that contains sensitive information of 12,472 Indian blood donors is posted on two forums.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Black Kingdom
Description: Researchers from REDTEAM.PL reveal that operators of Black Kingdom ransomware target enterprises with unpatched Pulse Secure VPN software or initial access on the network, exploiting CVE-2019-11510.
Tags: REDTEAM.PL, Black Kingdom, Pulse Secure, CVE-2019-11510, ransomware

Description: Rangely District Hospital (RDH) reveals to have been hit by a ransomware attack on April 2020.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Azerbaijani hackers publish the data of about 3,500 Armenian citizens (people infected with COVID-19 and their contacts).

Author: Maze
Description: The Maze ransomware gang hits Threadstone Advisors LLP, a US corporate advisory firm specialized in M&A.
Israeli software company Sapiens International falls victim to a ransomware attack, paying $250,000 in Bitcoin to hackers
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: For the past year, a site called Privnotes.com has been impersonating Privnote.com, a legitimate, free service that offers private, encrypted messages, to steal bitcoins.

Author: Anonymous USA (@AnonOpUSA)
Description: The Anonymous claim to have taken down the website of the Atlanta Police Department (atlantapd.org).
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security
Tags: Anonymous, Anonymous USA, @AnonOpUSA, Atlanta Police Department, atlantapd.org

Description: The details of 727,000 Foodora accounts in 14 countries are leaked online.
Target Class: I Accommodation and food service activities

Description: Geox, the Italian shoe maker is hit with a ransomware attack.
Researchers from Sansec reveal that the websites for U.S. based jewelry and accessory giant Claire's, and its subsidiary Icing, were compromised in April via a Magecart attack.
A new campaign starts to push fake data breach notifications for big company names that really suffered a breach, to distribute malware and scams.

Nine human rights activists, journalists, academics and lawyers in India have been targeted by a “coordinated” spyware operation, according to an investigation by Amnesty International and the Citizen Lab.
The website of Intersport, one of Europe's largest sporting goods retail chain, is hit by a Magecart attack.
Researchers at Intego warn Apple Mac users of a new malware in disguise of an installer for Adobe Flash Player (a variant of OSX/Shlayer and OSX/Bundlore), distributed via Google search results.
Tags: Apple, Mac, Adobe Flash Player, OSX/Shlayer, OSX/Bundlore, Intego, Google

Author: Vendetta
Description: Researchers from ElevenPaths reveal the details of Vendetta, a threat actor targeting technological, business and government sectors that handle sensitive information

Researchers from Risk Based Security reveal that personal data of an estimated 350,000 social media influencers has been accessed and partially leaked following a breach at social media marketing firm Preen.Me.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: South Africa’s Life Healthcare says its southern African operation is hit by a cyber attack affecting its admissions systems, business processing systems and email servers.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Researchers from Cofense discover a massive keylogger distribution campaign dubbed Mass Logger.
The University of the Philippines Visayas confirmed on its official Facebook page that its website, upv.edu.ph, was defaced on Thursday, June 11.
Tags: University of the Philippines Visayas, upv.edu.ph

Target: Countries across Europe and North America
Description: Social media research group Graphika publishes a report unmasking a new Russian information operation codenamed Secondary Infektion, active since 2014, relying on fake news articles, fake leaks, and forged documents to generate political scandals in countries across Europe and North America.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Researchers from Morphisec discover a new campaign exploiting a DLL hijacking vulnerability in Apple’s Push Service (APSDaemon) to install a cryptocurrency miner and avoid detection.
Tags: Morphisec, Apple’s Push Service, APSDaemon, crypto

Description: The New Zealand's national computer emergency response team warns of a crime gang seeking "ransomware attack opportunities" against NZ organizations that use unpatched or poorly secured Citrix remote-access technology.
Tags: New Zealand's national computer emergency response team, Citrix ransomware

Author: China
Description: China launches DDOS attacks against information websites and the country’s financial payments system, amid growing tensions over border disputes in the Kashmir region.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Amazon reveals that its AWS Shield service mitigated the largest DDoS attack ever recorded, stopping a 2.3 Tbps attack in mid-February this year.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: Lazarus Group
Description: Security researchers from ESET disclose a new operation orchestrated by the Lazarus Group codenamed "Operation In(ter)ception," targeting victims for both cyber-espionage and financial theft.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security
Tags: ESET, Lazarus Group, Operation In(ter)ception, North Korea

Author: Sodinokibi (AKA REvil)
Description: Sodinokibi ransomware (aka REvil) operators breach the Brazilian-based electrical energy company Light S.A. and demanding a $14 million worth ransom.
Target Class: D Electricity gas steam and air conditioning supply

Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Unit 42 discover a new malware, dubbed AcidBox, employed in targeted attacks against Russian organizations, and that leverages an exploit previously associated with the Russian-linked Turla APT group.
An unnamed webhost was is hit with one of the largest DDoS attacks ever registered by Akamai (1.44 terabit-per-second)
A Zoom meeting regarding issues surrounding police discipline is interrupted by callers shouting racist and homophobic remarks.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Subdomains of the Cebu Normal University (CNU) website, particularly the Library and Journal for Higher Education (JHE), are hacked by unknown entities.

Author: Pinoy Grayhats
Description: 1,000 student accounts from the Far Eastern University (FEU) are made public, with details such as names, student numbers, and passwords exposed.
Tags: Far Eastern University, FEU, Pinoy Grayhats

Author: InvisiMole and Gamaredon
Description: Researchers from ESET discover a new campaign carried out by the InvisiMole group in cooperation with Gamaredon (two groups linked to Russia).
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Researchers at Awake Security reveal that a newly discovered spyware attacked users through 32 million downloads of extensions to Google’s market-leading Chrome web browser. Google immediately removes 70 of the malicious extensions

Author: Holmium AKA APT33, StoneDrill and Elfin
Target: Aerospace, defence, chemical, mining, and petrochemical companies
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal the details of a new campaign by Holmium, a group targeting exposed Exchange servers.
Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a phishing campaign impersonating the Wells Fargo Security Team and luring potential victims to phishing pages with the help of calendar invites.

Target: European, Asian, and Middle Eastern targets
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a phishing campaign abusing an Adobe Campaign redirection mechanism, and using a Samsung domain to redirect victims to an O365 themed phishing website. The attackers also hijacked an Oxford email server to deliver the malicious emails.
Tags: Check Point, Adobe Campaign, Samsung, Office 365, Oxford

Description: Researchers from Armorblox discover a phishing campaign against Bank of America customers able to bypass security filters.
Researchers from Juniper discover a new version of the IcedID banking trojan employed in COVID-19 themed attacks exploiting FMLA.
Australian beverage giant Lion is hit by a second cyber attack.
Target Class: I Accommodation and food service activities

Description: Hackers steal data from RBX.Place, a grey marketplace where players of the massively popular online game Roblox can sell in-game items for real money.

Author: China?
Description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison calls a press conference to reveal that Australian organizations (government and private sector) are currently being targeted by a sophisticated state-based cyber actor. Fingers are pointed to China.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Anonymous
Description: A leak-focused activist group known as Distributed Denial of Secrets publishes BlueLeaks, a 269-gigabyte collection of police data, allegedly received from the Anonymous collective, which includes emails, audio, video, and intelligence documents, with more than a million files in total.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security
Tags: Distributed Denial of Secrets, BlueLeaks, Anonymous

Author: NetWalker
Description: Crozer-Keystone Health System suffers a ransomware attack by the NetWalker ransomware gang. The gang auctions the stolen data through its darknet website.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Popular Australian surfer Blaze Angel Roberts has her Instagram account hacked, posting sexually explicit images.

A new bitcoin scam allows attackers to steal more than $2 million in two months from Elon Musk's name. The trick involves the use of Bitcoin vanity addresses in order to give the scam more credibility.
An attacker breaks into the Mid-Michigan College’s email system, compromising the accounts of 10 employees and compromising personal data of potentially up to 16,000 people.
The Florida Orthopedic Institute warns of a ransomware attack suffered on April 9.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Multiple ConnectWise have their customers hit with ransomware through a software flaw.
A new malware dubbed NitroHack is distributed in disguise of the premium Discord Nitro service.
Tallapoosa County Probate Office is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Security researchers from Cyble discover over 230.000 Indonesian COVID-19 patients records leaked in the darknet.
A racist cyberattack email is delivered to thousands of University of California, Davis email accounts, prompting the university to block most of the emails, officials said Tuesday.

Author: CLOP
Description: Indian conglomerate Indiabulls Group is allegedly hit with a cyberattack from the CLOP Ransomware operators who have leaked screenshots of stolen data.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Security researchers from Trend Micro discover what appears to be the first organized and persistent series of attacks against Docker servers that infect misconfigured clusters with DDoS malware (XORDDoS AKA Backdoor.Linux.XORDDOS.AE and Kaiji DDoS AKA DDoS.Linux.KAIJI.A).
Tags: Trend Micro, Docker, DDoS, XORDDoS, Backdoor.Linux.XORDDOS.AE, Kaiji DDoS, DDoS.Linux.KAIJI.A

Target: Several dozen e-commerce sites using Google Analytics.
Description: Researchers from Sansec reveals they discovered a Magecart campaign using Google Analytics to bypass Content Security Policies.
Tags: Sansec, Google Analytics, Content Security Policies, Magecart

Description: Researchers from Darktrace discover a phishing campaign spoofing QuickBooks, a product commonly being used in advance of the July 15 tax deadline.

More than one million players of the video game Stalker Online are at risk after a database containing over 1.2 million user records is being sold on hacking forums. Separately, another database which is said to contain more than 136,000 records from the game’s forums are also being offered for sale.

Target: Government and military orgs in South Asia
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a military-themed malware campaign targeting military and government organizations in South Asia, using the Cobalt Strike toolset, and distributing a RAT via the IndigoDrop malware dropper.

Target: Mid-level employees across Austria, Switzerland and Germany
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a campaign spreading the Hakbit ransomware using malicious Microsoft Excel attachments and the GuLoader dropper.

Author: UK Police
Description: The encrypted chat Encrochat shuts down after a police hack.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Iowa State University officials announce hat nearly 4,900 Iowa State University-affiliated email accounts were the recipients of a racist cyberattack from an email sender claiming to be Equity Prime Mortgage.
CHI St. Luke’s Health-Memorial Lufkin notifies of a phishing incident occurred on April 23, 2020.

The US Federal Bureau of Investigation sends out a security alert to K12 schools about the increase in ransomware attacks during the COVID-19 pandemic, and especially about ransomware gangs that abuse RDP connections to break into school systems.

Author: Evil Corp
Description: Researchers from Fox-IT reveal that the malicious actor Evil Corp is now deploying the WastedLocker ransomware.

Author: Sodinokibi (AKA REvil)
Description: Researchers from Symantec discover a new variant of the Sodinokibi ransomware scanning networks for PoS systems.
Choice Health Management Services notifies an unspecified number of individuals of a phishing attack occurred in late 2019.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Target: Five cryptocurrency exchanges in United States, Japan, and the Middle East
Description: Researchers from ClearSky reveal the details of CryptoCore, an organized hacker group believed to be operating out of Eastern Europe, which has stolen around $200 million from online cryptocurrency exchanges
Researchers from Sophos reveal the details of Glupteba, an evasive malware that creates a backdoor providing full access to compromised Windows machines, while adding them to a growing botnet.
Researchers from Palo Alto Unit 42 reveal the details of a new variant of Lucifer, a powerful cryptojacking and DDoS malware exploiting severe vulnerabilities in order to infect Windows machines.
Researchers from ESET discover a malicious Android app in disguise of Canada's official COVID-19 tracing app, but hiding the CryCryptor ransomware.

Author: KelvinSecurity
Description: U.S. business consulting firm Frost & Sullivan is breached after data from an unsecured backup folder exposed on the Internet is sold on a hacker forum.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: Maze
Description: Maze ransomware operators claim on their website that they breached and locked the network of the South Korean multinational LG Electronics.

Author: Maze
Description: Maze ransomware operators update their list of victims adding Xerox Corporation.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a new Magecart campaign hiding the credit card skimmer inside images.
Akamai reveals that a bank in Europe was hit by a massive distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack that peaked a record 809 million packets per second (PPS).
Microsoft warns organizations of a spike of attacks against Microsoft Exchange servers trying to exploit CVE-2020-0688

Author: Chinese Bank
Target: UK-based technology/software vendor and a major financial institution
Description: Researchers from Trustwave reveal that a Chinese bank has forced at least two western companies to install a tax software infected with the GoldenSpy malware on their systems.
Researchers from Check Point detect a new campaign distributing phishing emails and malicious files disguised as COVID-19 training materials.

Author: DarkCrewFriends
Description: A report from Check Point reveals that the hackers-for-hire group DarkCrewFriends has resurfaced and is targeting content management systems to build a botnet.
Researchers from Barracuda Networks discover a new variant of the cryptominer malware known as Golang, targeting both Windows and Linux machines.

Author: Anonymous Brazil
Target: Senior Brazilian government officials including president Jair Bolsonaro.
Description: The Brazilian federal investigates the leak of personal details of senior government officials including president Jair Bolsonaro.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Media firm E27 is hacked, and attackers ask for a small "donation" to provide information on the vulnerabilities used in the attack.

Author: Ransom X
Description: A new ransomware called Ransom X is being actively used in human-operated and targeted attacks against government agencies and enterprises.
The France Télévisions group announces it was the victim of a cyber attack that targeted one of its broadcasting sites.

Target: Eight cities across three states in the United States
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that eight cities across three states in the United States have fallen victim to a Magecart card skimming attack. The sites all appear to have been built using Click2Gov.

The National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) is attacked by a malware.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security
Tags: National Highway Authority of India, NHAI

Author: Promethium AKA StrongPity APT
Description: In separate reports, researchers from Cisco Talos and BitDefender reveal new campaigns from the Promethium, AKA StrongPity APT.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Cl0ud SecuritY
Description: A hacker group going by the name of 'Cl0ud SecuritY' is breaking into old LenovoEMC (formerly Iomega) network-attached storage (NAS) devices, wiping files, and leaving ransom notes behind asking owners to pay between $200 and $275 to get their data back.

Researchers from Sophos discover a new phishing campaign targeting bloggers and website owners with emails pretending to be from their hosting provider who wants to upgrade their domain to use secure DNS (DNSSEC).
Researchers from Lucy Security discover a collection of SQL databases for sale on the Dark Web. The archived files were stolen from 945 websites around the world.

Duncannon reveals to have been hit with a ransomware attack in April, which left many municipal computer systems inoperable and caused the borough to pay out more than $40,000 to the hackers to restore systems.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Evil Corp
Description: Researchers from Symantec reveal that the Evil Corp gang hacked into dozens of US newspaper websites owned by the same company to infect the employees of over 30 major US private firms with the WastedLocker ransomware.
Tags: Symantec, Evil Corp, WastedLocker, SocGholish, ransomware

Description: Hackers use leaked credentials on pastebin to deface Roblox profiles to support Donald Trump in the forthcoming US presidential election.

Multiple security researchers discover a new ransomware strain targeting macOS users, called OSX.ThiefQuest (or EvilQuest). The malware also installs a keylogger, a reverse shell, and steals cryptocurrency wallet-related files from infected hosts.
Google removes 25 Android applications from the Google Play Store that were caught stealing Facebook credentials.
Tags: Google, Android, Google Play Store, Facebook

Description: Researchers from Group-IB discover thousands of personal records of users from multiple countries exposed in a targeted multi-stage bitcoin scam.
A new campaign targets the passport details of self-employed people, along with other information including personal and bank details, exploiting COVID-19-related HMRC phishing scams.

Description: The US Secret Service (GIOC -- Global Investigations Operations Center) sends out a security alert to the US private sector and government organizations warning about an increase in hacks of managed service providers (MSPs).
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities
Tags: US Secret Service, GIOC, Global Investigations Operations Center, MSP

Author: Maze
Description: Benefit Recovery Specialists, Inc. (BRSI) discovers a data breach after detecting malware on its systems. The malware, discovered on April 2020, may have allowed unauthorized individuals to obtain the information of 274,837 people.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities
Tags: Benefit Recovery Specialists, Inc., BRSI, ransomware

Description: Hackers from the Kerala Cyber Hackers Group obtain COVID-19 patient database in protest at treatment of Indian health workers.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security
Tags: Delhi State Health Mission, Kerala Cyber Hackers, COVID-19

Description: A group of dissidents within Iran's military and security forces takes credit for a cyber attack causing an incident at the Natanz nuclear facility.

Description: The City of Palm Bay leadership reveals a possible security breach involving the Click2Gov online payment platform.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: The Central California Alliance for Health announces that a recent cybersecurity breach may have compromised the personal health information of a limited number of its members.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: M.J. Brunner is hit with a Maze ransomware attack.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: New Mexico State University Foundation is another victim of the Blackbaud hack.
Tags: New Mexico State University Foundation, Blackbaud, ransomware

Description: A hacker uploads ransom notes on 22,900 MongoDB databases left exposed online without a password, wiping their content, asking for a 0.015 bitcoin (~$140) payment. and threatening to leak their data and then contact the victim's local GDPR enforcement authority.

Author: Roaming Mantis
Target: Android users in China, Taiwan, France, Switzerland, Germany, UK, US and other
Description: Researchers from Cybereason discover a campaign distributing the FakeSpy Android malware via a phishing message for a missed package from a local postal or delivery service.
The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) warn enterprises of cyberattacks launched from the Tor network.
Tags: Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, CISA, Federal Bureau of Investigation, FBI, Tor

Author: NetWalker
Description: The cybercriminals behind NetWalker publish online evidence of an attack on Trinity Metro, a transit agency that operates bus and commuter rail transportation services in Fort Worth and its nearby Tarrant County suburbs.

Author: China
Description: Researchers from Lookout discover four Android surveillance tools, named SilkBean, DoubleAgent, CarbonSteal, and GoldenEagle, elements of campaigns originating in China, and primarily targeting the Uyghur ethnic minority.
Tags: Lookout, Android, SilkBean, DoubleAgent, CarbonSteal, GoldenEagle, Uyghur

Description: Researchers from CenturyLink discover a comeback of the point-of-sale (POS) malware called Alina, using a new trick for stealing credit- and debit-card data: Domain Name System (DNS) tunneling.

Target: Financial, Manufacturing, Healthcare and Insurance Firms
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a new campaign carried out by the group behind the Valak malware, targeting Financial, Manufacturing, Healthcare and Insurance Firms.
Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a new campaign impersonating a Twitter security notification email, to lure the victims towards a phishing page.
Unknown hackers hijack the Twitter account of Russia’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs, offer to sell stolen data.

Tags: Russia’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Twitter

Target: BMW car owners in the U.K.

The names and Social Security numbers of 56,000 people who used CNY Works employment services are exposed in a ransomware discovered in December 2019.

Author: Avaddon
Description: Researchers from Microsoft discover a new Avaddon ransomware campaign focused primarily against organizations in Italy.

Author: Try2Cry
Description: Researchers from G DATA discover Try2Cry, a new ransomware with a worm-like behavior to infect other systems.
Kingston’s Royal Military College is one of four military training schools in Canada targeted in a ransomware attack.
Swvl, a bus-booking app and operator of bus routes in Egypt, Kenya, and Pakistan, becomes aware of “unauthorized access to its IT infrastructure”.
Logins for more than 3600 MyGov accounts are for sale on the dark web.

Author: Nefilim
Description: Orange is hit with a ransomware attack through the "Orange Business Solutions" division.
Tags: Orange, Orange Business Solutions, ransomware, Nefilim

Description: Researchers from NCC Group reveal that hackers have started launching attacks against F5 BIG-IP networking devices.

Author: Sodinokibi (AKA REvil)
Target: Sheriff's Office for Cooke County, Texas
Description: The Sheriff's Office for Cooke County is hit by a ransomware attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security
Tags: Sodinokibi, REvil, Sheriff's Office for Cooke County

Description: Global IT services and solutions provider DXC Technology announces over the weekend a ransomware attack on systems from its Xchanging subsidiary.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: The personal information of 10,000 patients is compromised after a medical study in Turkey suffers a cyber attack.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Researchers from ProofPoint reveal that the criminals behind the Purple Fox fileless downloader malware recently upgraded their operation, targeting two new vulnerabilities (CVE-2020-0674 and CVE-2019-1458).

Author: Lazarus Group AKA Hidden Cobra
Description: Researchers from Sansec reveal that North Korea's state-sponsored hacking crews are breaking into online stores for Magecart attacks.
Tags: Sansec, Magecart, Lazarus Group, Hidden Cobra

Author: Sheriff
Description: Using the alias “Sheriff,” a threat actor advertises an auction for 62,000 accounts belonging to users of the eToro social trading platform.

Target: Multiple cryptocurrency exchanges and online trading platforms
Description: Another threat actor puts on sale a list of accounts belonging to payment/money transfer systems, cryptocurrency exchange and online trading platforms, including Advcash, Azimo, Binance, Bitcan, Coinmama, Coinsbank, Neteller, OKPAY, Payoneer, Paypal, Skrill, Yandex Money, Webmoney, Qiwi, along with many others.
Tags: Advcash, Azimo, Binance, Bitcan, Coinmama, Coinsbank, Neteller, OKPAY, Payoneer, Paypal, Skrill, Yandex Money, Webmoney, Qiwi

Description: A new release of the Lampion trojan banker targets uses in Portugal.
Researchers from Malwarebytes identify a new card skimmer campaign targeting ASP.NET sites and exploiting CVE-2017-9248.
Brazilian health insurer Hapvida reveals to have suffered a cyber attack potentially involving access to the personal information of its customers.

BCycle, a bicycle sharing service, suffered a malware attack in April and launches an investigation, according to a company letter. The stolen information may have included names, credit card numbers and addresses.

Author: Keeper
Description: Researchers from Gemini Advisory reveal the details of Keeper, a group responsible for compromising more than 570 e-commerce websites with Magecart Attacks.

Author: Cosmic Lynx
Description: Researchers from Agari reveal the details of Cosmic Lynx, a BEC campaign targeting individuals in 200 companies across 46 countries.

Author: C-Data?
Description: Two security researchers discover severe vulnerabilities and what appears to be intentional backdoors in the firmware of devices from popular Chinese vendor C-Data.
Mozilla temporarily suspends the Firefox Send file-sharing service as the organization investigates reports of abuse from malware operators.
Security researchers from Avast discover the Cerberus banking Trojan disguised as a legitimate currency app on Google Play.
Researchers at Abnormal Security uncover a campaign aiming to steal Office 365 user credentials using SurveyMonkey as cover.
Chilton County shuts down after being targeted by a suspected ransomware attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: More than 240 website subdomains belonging to organizations large and small, including household names, are hijacked to redirect users to malware, X-rated material, online gambling, and other unexpected content.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover pre-installed malware on a budget Android phone ANS (American Network Solutions) UL40 handset connected to Assurance Wireless by Virgin Mobile.
Tags: Malwarebytes, Android, ANS, American Network Solutions, UL40, Assurance Wireless, Virgin Mobile

Description: Researchers from Carbon Black discover Conti, a ransomware strain using up to 32 simultaneous CPU threads to encrypt files on infected computers for blazing-fast encryption speeds.
Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a new phishing campaign using fake Zoom notifications to steal Office 365 logins.
Microsoft issues a warning for Office 365 phishing attacks carried out via malicious OAuth apps.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover a new version of the Mirai IoT botnet that includes an exploit for the CVE-2020-10173 vulnerability impacting Comtrend routers.
Researchers from Cyble identify a threat actor claiming to be in possession of more than 500,000 confidential data records of Impact Guru, a crowdfunding platform.
Researchers from Wordfence reveal that a vulnerability on the Adning Advertising plugin for WordPress is currently under attack.
Researchers from Check Point discover a new version of the Joker malware in Google Play
Researchers from the SANS Institute reveal that threat actor are scanning the internet for two recently-discovered Citrix vulnerabilities (CVE-2020-8195, CVE-2020-8196)
Researchers from Cyble discover 5 M records from Religare Health Insurance up for sale in the dark web.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Cloudflare reveals that on June 21 it detected and mitigated a packet-based volumetric DDoS attack that peaked at 754 million packets-per-second.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: People in the UK are targeted by a new phishing scam designed to trick victims into handing over details of their HSBC bank account.
A fake TikTok app targets Indian users.
Researchers from Kaspersky discover over 1000 inactive websites compromised to redirect visitors to unwanted URLs, many of which are malicious and distribute the Shlayer trojan.

Author: Magadimarus
Description: LiveAuctioneers discloses a data breach after a well-known data breach broker begins selling 3.4 million stolen user records on a hacker forum.

Target: ENAC (Ente Nazionale Aviazione Civile), Italian Agency for the Civil Aviation
Description: The Italian Agency for the Civil Aviation is hit with a cyber attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Netwalker
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover internal data from Alfanar leaked from the Netwalker ransomware operators.
A malicious hacker disrupts a Jewish congregation's virtual prayer service to display symbols synonymous with anti-Semitism.
Vancouver Coastal Health reveals to have suffered a ransomware attack on May 21.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Target: SEC registrants and service providers to SEC registrants.

Tags: SEC, Office of Compliance Inspections and Examinations, OCIE, ransomware

Description: U.K.-based cryptocurrency exchange Cashaa reports that hackers stole more than 336 Bitcoin (BTC) and ceases all the crypto-related transactions.
Indian delivery service Dunzo said it suffers a data breach that left customer data including email IDs and phone numbers exposed, after attackers accessed one of its databases.
Target Class: I Accommodation and food service activities

Author: AgeLocker
Description: A new and targeted ransomware named AgeLocker utilizes the 'Age' encryption tool created by a Google employee to encrypt victim's files.
A new password-stealing trojan spam campaign adds an anti-sandbox evasion check.

Target: 45 million travelers to Thailand and Malaysia from multiple countries
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover the availability on the dark web of records of over 45 million travelers to Thailand and Malaysia from multiple countries.
Security researchers at Cyble discover the availability on the dark web of personal details of approximately 40,000 US citizens along with their social security numbers (SSNs).
Antwerp-based savings bank Argenta shuts down 143 ATM machines after falling victim to what is believed to be Belgium’s first jackpotting attacks.

Author: NightLion
Description: A hacker going by the handle of NightLion claims to have breached the backend servers belonging to DataViper, a cyber security firm, and dumps 8,225 databases.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: An allegedly stolen Wattpad database containing 270 million records is being sold in private sales for over $100,000 and offered for free on hacker forums.

Description: Researchers from ESET discover Welcome Chat, a chat application for Android with spying capabilities.

Author: Maze
Description: Collabera discloses a ransomware attack occurred on June, 8.

Description: Hackers from the LulzSecurityITA collective dump the list of 23 databases from the Airports of Milan Linate and Milan Malpensa, allegedly accessed.
Roger Torrent, the speaker of Catalan parliament, and at least two other pro-independence supporters, have reportedly been told their phones were targeted last year using the ‘Pegasus’ spyware.

Author: Jamescarter
Description: Security researchers from KELA discover a database containing millions of emails and usernames up for sale on the dark web, linked to a well-known UK ticketing provider.
Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that the "Tetrade", a set of four Brazilian banking trojans (Guildma, Javali, Melcoz, Grandoreiro) is now spreading globally.
Tags: Kaspersky, Tetrade, Guildma, Javali, Melcoz, Grandoreiro

Author: RATicate
Description: Researchers from Sophos discover another campaign carried out by the RATIcate group, using the CloudEye tool

Target: Targets in Iran, Russia, China, and North Korea

Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security
Tags: CIA, Central Intelligence Agency, Russia, China, North Korea

Description: An actor sells what they claim to be a database with information on 2,000,000 Citrix customers on the dark web. An official statement by the company reveals that the database has ben obtained from a third-party.

Description: A number of high profile Twitter accounts, including Bill Gates, Elon Musk and Apple, are hijacked to promote a bitcoin scam. The author of the hack is arrested by the FBI two weeks later.
Tags: Twitter, Bill Gates, Elon Musk, Apple, bitcoin, Graham Ivan Clark

Description: ATM maker Diebold Nixdorf warns banks of a new type of ATM "black box" attack that was recently spotted used across Europe.

Author: Mustang Panda
Description: China's government hackers have targeted members of the Hong Kong Catholic Church in a series of spear-phishing operations traced back to May this year.
Tags: Mustang Panda, China, Catholic Church, Hong Kong

Description: Blackbaud, a cloud software provider specializing in fundraising suites for charities and educational institutions, discloses a ransomware attack occurred on May, 2020.

Description: Researchers from Aqua Security discover a new campaign exploits misconfigured Docker API ports in order to infect victims with a resource-hijacking cryptominer.
Researchers from Bad Packets report that threat actors have been scanning the Internet for SAP systems affected by RECON vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2020-6287.

Target: Tax Collector’s Office for Polk County
Description: Tax Collector’s Office for Polk County blames malware found on an employee's computer for a data breach that affected around 450,000 residents of Polk County. The breach occurred in June.

Tags: Tax Collector’s Office for Polk County

Description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation issues a warning to air travelers to be wary of bogus US airport websites when booking flights online.

Description: Researchers from ThreatFabric discover a new Android banking trojan dubbed BlackRock.

Target: Targets across the US and Europe in the professional, healthcare, IT, manufacturing, logistics, and travel sector

Emotet, 2019's most active cybercrime operation and malware botnet, returns to life with new attacks.

Author: Netwalker
Description: Lorien Health Services announces that it was the victim of a ransomware incident in early June. Data was stolen and then encrypted during the incident.

Description: Security researchers from Group-IB reveal the details of UltraRank, a cybercriminal group specialized in infecting online shops to steal payment card data, responsible for compromising almost 700 websites and more than a dozen third-party service providers.
The npm security team removes a malicious JavaScript library, named "fallguys", from the npm portal, designed to steal sensitive files from an infected users' browser and Discord application.

More than a dozen ISPs across Europe report DDoS attacks targeting their DNS infrastructure. The list includes Belgium's EDP, France's Bouygues Télécom, FDN, K-net, SFR, and the Netherlands' Caiway, Delta, FreedomNet, Online.nl, Signet, and Tweak.nl.
Tags: DNS, EDP, Bouygues Télécom, FDN, K-net, SFR, Caiway, Delta, FreedomNet, Online.nl, Signet, Tweak.nl.

Description: The Irish Department of Social Protection warns against “sophisticated” phishing scams.

Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that Turkish-speaking cybercriminals are sending Instagram users seemingly legitimate messages from the social media company, with the aim of stealing their Instagram and email credentials.
Defense supplier PULAU Corporation notifies their employees about an intrusion and unauthorized access into parts of their network between June 11 and June 29.

Author: LuckyMouse
Target: Multiple targets including the Office of the President, the Ministry of Justice, the Ministry of Health, various local law enforcement agencies, and many local governments
Description: Researchers from ESET and Avast discover Operation StealthyTrident, an operation compromising Able Software, a Mongolian software company and compromised a chat app used by hundreds of Mongolian government agencies.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Bangladesh-based group
Target: Local activists, journalists and religious minorities
Description: Security researchers from Facebook disrupts the infrastructure used by a local group in Bangladesh in their latest campaign.
Microsoft warns of an ongoing campaign pushing a new browser hijacking and credential-stealing malware dubbed Adrozek which, at its peak, was able to take over more than 30,000 devices every day.

Author: Multiple actors
Target: K-12 educational institutions in the US
Description: A joint advisory by the FBI, the CISA, and MS-ISAC warns that K-12 educational institutions in the U.S. are being targeted by ransomware.
A phishing scam is underway that targets Ledger wallet users with fake data breach notifications used to steal cryptocurrency from recipients.

Author: PLEASE_READ_ME
Description: Researchers from Guardicore reveal that the malicious actors behind the PLEASE_READ_ME ransomware campaign have set up an auction site on the dark web to sell 250,000 databases stolen from tens of thousands of breached MySQL servers.
Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover PGMiner, a botnet operation that targets PostgreSQL databases to install a cryptocurrency miner.
Brooklyn Defender Services discovers that an unauthorized person gained access to some of employees’ email accounts on September 13, 2020.

Author: Ragnar Locker
Description: Dassault Falcon Jet, a US subsidiary of the French aviation firm Dassault Aviation, is hit by the Ragnar Locker ransomware.
The town of Ludlow is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: A hacked database belonging to Fax Express is exposed, revealing approximately 560,000 compromised usernames and dehashed passwords.
Unknown hackers try to break into Air France-KLM.
Employment Specialists of Maine notifies 2,000 patients of a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: ALTDOS
Description: Country Group Securities is hacked and has some data dumped.
Researchers from Abnormal Security reveal the details of a phishing campaign designed to harvest Office 365 credentials using a Microsoft Outlook migration message.
Unknown hackers disclose 4GB of data belonging to Panasonic India.
Researchers from Armorblox reveal the details of a phishing campaign claiming that the recipient has been shortlisted for COVID compensation from IMF.

Author: Pay2Key
Description: Amital Software is hit by the Pay2Key ransomware.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Subway UK marketing system is hacked to send out TrickBot malware-laden phishing emails sent to customers.
Target Class: I Accommodation and food service activities

Description: Konikoff Dental Associates Harbour View warns patients of a possible data breach related to suspicious activity in its environment.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The Jersey City reveals to have been hit by a ransomware attack back in October.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: AMG Energia is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: D Electricity gas steam and air conditioning supply

Description: The City of Marieville is hit by a ransomware attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: The Socorro Independent School District is taken down by a ransomware attack.
Designer Brands Inc. reports in its earnings call that a vendor was hit with a ransomware attack in September and had to voluntarily shut down its systems.
The City of Meadville reveals to have been hit with a ransomware attack on October 8th.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: The New York State Department of Motor Vehicles alerts consumers after several New Yorkers reported receiving phishing texts asking for personal information.

Author: Pay2Key
Description: ​Intel-owned AI processor developer Habana Labs suffers a Pay2Key ransomware attacks and has the data leaked.

Author: Clop
Description: Symrise, a German manufacturer of flavors and fragrances used in products, has reportedly been the victim of a ransomware attack.

Target: 1.9 million members of the Chinese Communist Party
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover the details of 1.9 million members of the Chinese Communist Party leaked on a hacking forum.

Author: AridViper (AKA Desert Falcon and APT-C-23),
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover PyMICROPSIA, a new Windows info-stealing malware linked to AridViper.
Norwegian cruise company Hurtigruten announces to have been hit by a major ransomware attack.

Researchers from Juniper discover a new wave of attacks by the Gitpaste-12 worm, targeting web applications, IP cameras and routers, with an expanded set of exploits for initially compromising devices.
Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a coordinated phishing campaign using fake fax alerts emails sent from legitimate, compromised accounts, and aiming to steal O365 credentials.
Huber & Suhner from is hit with a cyber attack that blocks the company’s production facilities worldwide.
The website of Great Neck Yeshiva High School is down following an apparent hack in which anti-Semitic propaganda and racial slurs are reportedly published.
The Weslaco Independent School District is hit with a ransomware attack.

Target: Customers of multiple US and EU banks
Description: Researchers from IBM Trusteer reveal that threat actors behind an ongoing worldwide mobile banking fraud campaign were able to steal millions from multiple US and EU banks, spoofing more than 16,000 devices via emulators.

Author: Russian Internet Research Agency
Target: Countries mainly in north Africa and some in the Middle East
Description: Facebook removes two networks based in Russia associated to the Russian Internet Research Agency accusing them of carrying out interference campaigns in Africa.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Network linked to the French Military
Target: Countries mainly in north Africa and some in the Middle East
Description: Facebook removes one network linked to the French military, accused of carrying out interference campaigns in Africa.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Target: Multiple targets in the healthcare sector
Description: Researchers from CybelAngel discover 2000 servers containing 45 million images of X-rays and other medical scans left online during the course of the past twelve months, freely accessible by anyone and in some cases infected by malware.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Russia?
Description: In a coordinated cyber-attack on Lithuania, cyber-criminals breach multiple content management systems to gain access to 22 different websites operated by Lithuania's public sector. The attackers then published articles containing misinformation on the sites, including fake news against Polonia
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Target: Internet Service Providers and targets in India
Description: Researchers from Cofense discover a new version of the Agent Tesla infostealer targeting specifically ISPs and individuals in India.
A Zoom meeting in the Firelands Middle School is suspended after a Zoom bombing incident
Promutuel Assurance is hit with a cyber attack that makes the company’s critical IT systems unavailable for use.
The city of Pantin is hit by a possible ransomware attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: NetWalker
Description: Staircase Financial Management is hit with a NetWalker ransomware attack.

Author: Pay2Key (Fox Kitten)
Description: After breaking into Amital Software, the Iranian threat actors behind the Pay2Key ransomware steal their clients' list and launch their attack against them.

Author: Ransomexx
Description: Automotive services provider Inchcape Australia appears to have been hit by the Ransomexx ransomware, with the cyber criminals leaking some data that they stole, on the dark web
Target Class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: Roanoke College delays the spring semester by almost a month after a cyberattack (probably ransomware) impacts files and data access.

Target: Users in France, Italy, Denmark, and the US.
Description: Researchers from Vade Secure discover a new campaign able to bypass the transport layer via a new tool called Email Appender.

Researchers from Avast identify malware hidden in at least 28 third party Google Chrome (15) and Microsoft Edge (13) extensions, downloaded around three million times, associated with some of the world’s most popular platforms.
A threat actor is distributing fake Windows and Android installers for the Cyberpunk 2077 game that is installing a ransomware calling itself CoderWare.

Target: Chinese speaking countries, Korea, and Japan
Description: Researchers from Lookout reveal the details of Goontact, a new malware strain with spying and surveillance capabilities, available in both Android and iOS versions.

Author: Hade
Description: Trucking and freight logistics company Forward Air suffers a Hade ransomware attack.
Researchers from Sansec discover a new Magecart campaign, targeting 41 stores, thanks to a mistake in the Remote Access Tool used to compromise the sites.
Researchers from Sonatype discover two new RubyGems packages laden with a cryptocurrency malware (pretty_color and ruby-bitcoin).
Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a new phishing campaign using a fake IRS W-8BEN form as its mechanism, targeting users of Google's G Suite.
MEDNAX Services reveals it was the victim of a phishing attack.
Target Class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: Taylor Made Diagnostics has some data published by ransomware operators.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: While analyzing artifacts from the SolarWinds Orion supply-chain attack, security researchers from Palo Alto and Microsoft discover SUPERNOVA, another backdoor that is likely from a second threat actor.

Target: Vietnamese private companies and government agencies
Description: Researchers from ESET discover "Operation SignSight", a supply chain attack against Vietnamese private companies and government agencies, carried out by inserting malware inside two applications of an official government software toolkit (Vietnam Government Certification Authority - VGCA)
People’s Energy Company reveals that it was the victim of a cyberattack in which an unauthorized party accessed one of the systems used to store member data.
Target Class: D Electricity gas steam and air conditioning supply

Description: Researchers from Trend micro discover a new infostealer written in AutoHotkey (AHK), targeting the US and Canadian bank customers as part of an ongoing campaign that has begun in early 2020.
Researchers from Menlo Labs uncover an increase in a drive-by attack that impersonates legitimate browser, Flash, and Microsoft Teams updates, using the “SocGholish” framework.
The City if Évreux and its municipality is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Fareva, a pharmaceutical manufacturer involved in the COVID-19 vaccine production, is hit with a cyber attack.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: The US Department of Justice seizes two domain names used to impersonate the official websites of biotechnology companies Moderna and Regeneron involved in the development of COVID-19 vaccines.
Researchers from Cyble discover a targeted phishing campaign against Kraeber & Co, a company involved in the COVID-19 vaccine development.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Target: 36 Al Jazeera journalists, producers, anchors, and executives, and a journalist at Al Araby TV
Description: Researchers from The Citizen Lab reveal the details of a campaign targeting at least 36 Al Jazeera journalists, producers, anchors, and executives, and a journalist at Al Araby TV. According to the researchers the campaign, part of an exploit chain named Kismet created and sold by NSO Group, was carried out using a zero-day for the iOS messaging app.

Author: Pay2Key
Description: The ransomware group Pay2Key, linked to Iran, claims to have successfully hacked the largest Israeli airpower defense corporation: Israel Aerospace Industries.
The City of Paderborn's Lernstatt is hit with a DDoS attack that blocks 17,000 student and 2000 teacher accounts.
Premier Kids Care reveals it was hit by a cyberattack back in April, where an unauthorized actor had gained access to its systems.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: British cryptocurrency exchange EXMO discloses that unknown attackers withdrew almost 5% of its total assets after compromising its hot wallets.
The City of Ellensburg is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Viandes Dubreton is hit by a probable ransomware attack.
Target Class: I Accommodation and food service activities

Description: The Albertville Hospital (Hôpital d'Albertville) is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The Jefferson County Property Valuation Administrator‘s office reveals it was hit by a ransomware attack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a new campaign impersonating the New York Department of Labor as a COVID-19 lure, claiming to administer relief funds in order to steal sensitive personal information.
Funke Media Group, one of the biggest media organizations in German-speaking territories is the victim of a ransomware attack.

Author: Emotet
Description: Researchers from Cofense reveal a new spike of attacks using the Emotet botnet after a break lasted almost two months.
The European Court of Human Rights falls victim to a cyber-attack after publishing a ruling regarding the fate of Selahattin Demirtaş, an incarcerated Turkish political leader.
Target Class: U Activities of extraterritorial organizations and bodies

Description: The NetGalley book promotion site suffers a data breach that allow threat actors to access a database with members' personal information.
A large scale phishing scam pretends to be a security notice from Chase stating that fraudulent activity has been detected and caused the recipient's account to be blocked.

Author: Lazarus Group
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal details on a COVID-19-themed campaign, carried out by the North Korean actor Lazarus Group, and targeting a pharmaceutical company.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: Lazarus Group
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal details on a COVID-19-themed campaign, carried out by the North Korean actor Lazarus Group, and targeting a health ministry.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a credential phishing attack impersonating the U.S. Postal Service aiming to get victims to give up their credit card credentials.
TaskRabbit resets an unknown number of customer passwords after confirming it detected “suspicious activity” on its network.
Target Class: N Administrative and support service activities

Author: Iranian threat actors
Description: The FBI and CISA reveal to have discovered Iranian cyber actors responsible for the creation of a website called Enemies of the People, which contained death threats aimed at U.S. election officials in mid-December 2020.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Proliance Surgeons discloses a data security incident affecting its corporate website exposing customers' credit cards.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Conti
Description: Leon Medical Center confirms a Conti ransomware attack.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Innovaphone, a provider of business IP telephony solutions, is hit by a hacker.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: About 30,000 customers of Now:Pensions have their sensitive personal details being posted on the internet after an outside contractor is breached.

Author: UltraRank
Target: At least a dozen e-commerce sites
Description: Researchers from Group-IB reveal that a cybercriminal gang known as "UltraRank" has launched a new campaign, targeting at least a dozen e-commerce sites to steal payment card data using a JavaScript sniffer, says security firm

Author: Conti
Description: Sangoma discloses a data breach after 26 GB of data were stolen during a recent Conti ransomware attack and published online.

Author: Pay2Key (Fox Kitten)
Description: The ransomware group Pay2Key, which has been linked to Iran, claims to have stolen almost 1TB of data (and as a proof publishes 3 gigabytes) from the Israeli cyber security company Portnox.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: REvil AKA Sodinokibi
Description: The REvil ransomware gang hacks The Hospital Group and threatens to release before-and-after pictures of celebrity clients.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Citrix confirms that an ongoing 'DDoS attack pattern is affecting Citrix Application Delivery Controller (ADC) networking appliances.
Researchers from Cybereason discover a new campaign distributing the Dridex malware via fake Amazon Gift Cards.

Author: Magecart
Description: Researchers from Sansec discover a new multi-platform credit card skimmer able to harvest payment info on compromised stores powered by Shopify, BigCommerce, Zencart, and Woocommerce.
Russian cryptocurrency exchange Livecoin posts a message on its official website, claiming it was hacked and lost control of some of its servers, warning customers to stop using its services.
The Scottish Environment Protection Agency (Sepa) is hit by a "significant" cyberattack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: The Agency for Community Treatment Services (ACTS) announces today that it suffered a ransomware attack on October 23, 2020.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: A data breach broker sells the allegedly stolen 368.8 million user records for twenty-six companies on a hacker forum.
A data breach broker sells the allegedly stolen 368.8 million user records for twenty-six companies on a hacker forum.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Japanese game developer Koei Tecmo discloses a data breach and take their European and American websites offline after stolen data of 65.000 users is posted to a hacker forum..
The broker Freedom Finance admits the leak of the data of 16,000 clients on a dark web forum.

Author: Muddy Water
Description: A new operation by the Muddy Water threat group uses a new macro-based malware that is evasive and spawns payload in multifaceted steps.

Target: Users in multiple countries including Egypt, the Philippines, Pakistan, and Nepal.
Description: Researchers from ThreatNix discover a new large-scale campaign abusing Facebook ads to redirect users to Github accounts hosting phishing pages used to steal victims’ login credentials. The campaign targeted more than 615,000 users in multiple countries including Egypt, the Philippines, Pakistan, and Nepal.
NZBGeek, a popular Usenet site, is hacked with user information including credit card details stolen.

Author: Nefilim
Description: Home appliances giant Whirlpool suffers a ransomware attack by the Nefilim ransomware gang who stole data before encrypting devices.
The Parliament of Finland reveals that email accounts of multiple members were compromised following a cyberattack.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: German cruise line AIDA Cruises suffers mysterious "IT restrictions" that lead to the cancellation of New Year's Eve cruises.
Kawasaki Heavy Industries announces a security breach and potential data leak after unauthorized access to a Japanese company server from multiple overseas offices.

The personal data of over 2.5 million Ho-Mobile’s customers is putt on sale on a dark web hacker forum. The data includes personally identifiable information such as date of births, phone numbers, fiscal codes physical addresses, and email addresses.
The Voyager cryptocurrency brokerage platform halted trading yesterday after suffering a cyberattack targeting their DNS configuration.
The US Treasury Department's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) warns financial institutions of ransomware actively targeting COVID-19 vaccine research organizations.

The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) warns users of smart devices to strengthen the login credentials after a recent spate of swatting attacks where perpetrators have hijacked smart gadgets to watch or live stream the bad joke.
Cloud storage provider Wasabi suffers an outage after a domain used for storage endpoints was suspended for hosting malware.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: SNAI, one of the main legal gaming operators in Italy, announces that it has been the subject of a suspected ransomware attack.

Author: Spiderz
Description: A hacker group called Spiderz claims to have successfully hacked into the Hezbollah's Al-Qard Al-Hassan financial organization and leaks details on depositors and borrowers from the lender.
Five Points Eye Care reports a phishing attack occurred in October 2020.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The Ville et Agglomération de La Rochelle are hit with a ransomware attack.

Description: T-Mobile announces a data breach exposing customers' proprietary network information (CPNI), including phone numbers and call records, after a "malicious, unauthorized access".
The Malaysian Armed Forces (MAF) reveals to have been hit by a cyber attack.

The City of Cornelia is hit with a ransomware attack.

Description: Treasure Valley Community College reveals to have suffered a phishing attack.
ROMWE, a Chinese e-commerce shop reveals to have suffered a data breach. Potentially 7.3 million user records have been compromised.

Description: The internal networks of Lithuania's National Center for Public Health (NVSC) and several municipalities are with Emotet malware following a large campaign targeting the country's state institutions.

Description: GenRx Pharmacy, warns 137,000 patients over a potential data breach following a ransomware attack.

Description: Nygard, a Canada-based fashion line, is hit with a ransomware attack.
IndiGo, India’s biggest airline, reveals some segments of its data servers were breached in a hacking incident in December, which may have compromised some data.
The ambulance service in Wrocław reveals to have been hit by a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Brendon Gyermekáruház Kft., a retailer of baby clothes, reveals to have been hit with a Zeppelin ransomware attack.
The Agglomeration de Grand Annecy is hit with a malware attack.

Description: A multinational engineering company headquartered in Pune is defrauded of 56,000 euros.

Description: The New York City Department of Education reveals to have been hit with a ransomware attack.
